revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Info-Motion |model=Motion HD V-1 |fcc_date=03/11/2013 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |type=Android media player |fcc_id=RT7-MOTIONHDV1 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_conn=barrel |ram1_num=4 |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=2 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_txchains=1 |wi1_rxchains=1 |wi1_sstreams=1 |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |flags=HDMI,audio out (3.5mm) |tp_firmware=Android |802dot11_protocols=bgn }} Terrible FCC internal photos..
The device ''may'' be '''Rockchip''' based. It appears to be using a '''Micron''' NAND Flash chip. The wireless module appears to be using a '''Realtek''' RTL8188CUS/CTV/EUS (or perhaps an RT5370, same general form factor).
The manufacturer of the device is stated as the following in the FCC test report.. *'''Winme Internation Co., Limited''' *2-3th Floor, Block 6, Xiaweiyuan Industry Park, Gushu Area, Bao'an District *Shenzhen, China
